title: The Big Plastic Count: Consumers confront their plastic footprint
description: People who counted plastic waste for a week want to go plastic-free, but say it costs too much.

title: U2 singer Bono discusses discovering he has a half-brother
description: The star discusses for the first time how his dad had another son, who he didn't know about for years.

title: Nigerian Ife head: Why UK police are holding a priceless sculpture
description: Original Ife bronze heads, of which only some 20 survive, are thought to be about 700 years old.

title: Friendship forged through rare disease connection
description: Saul and George are both 12 and their lives have been affected in some way by a rare disease.

title: Ukraine war: Inside Ukraine's International Legion of foreign fighters
description: The BBC speaks to some of the thousands of foreign soldiers who have joined the fight against Russia.

title: Roe v Wade: Protesters tear-gassed outside Arizona State Capitol
description: A video uploaded to social media shows police shooting tear gas into crowds of protesters.

title: G7 face battle for unity as cost of Ukraine war mounts
description: The Russian war against Ukraine will inevitably dominate the summit of G7 nations in Bavaria.

title: European Under-19 Championship: Israel 0-1 England - highlights
description: Watch highlights of England's 1-0 win over Israel at the European Under-19 Championships, with Manchester City striker Liam Delap scoring the only goal.

title: What's the mood after by-election dramas?
description: The verdict of voters can't be ignored and there are challenges ahead for the UK's big political parties.

title: Roe v Wade: The world reacts to US abortion ruling
description: Our correspondents in Italy, El Salvador, India, Ireland and Canada explain the impact in countries across the globe.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: hospital struggles to help survivors
description: Caring for victims is a challenge in a country already in the grip of a humanitarian crisis.

title: Rail strikes: Union boss urges government to 'tone down rhetoric'
description: Passengers across Britain are facing a third day of travel disruption as rail strikes continue.

title: Deontay Wilder: American heavyweight 'considering' return to boxing
description: Former heavyweight world champion Deontay Wilder says he is 'considering' a return to boxing.

title: Lauren Laverne pulls out of Glastonbury after her mother dies
description: The presenter says she is "utterly heartbroken", adding "Mam, I love you forever".

title: PM: I will not undergo psychological transformation after poll defeat
description: Boris Johnson tells the BBC he has to distinguish between criticism that matters and that doesn't.

title: Wimbledon: Serena Williams, Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic & Andy Murray lead stellar cast
description: A stellar cast of ageing greats has assembled for what could be one of the final times at Wimbledon as the jewel of the British sporting summer returns.

title: Beautiful Gwynedd beaches fail to entice one job applicant
description: Why can't Gwynedd council get anyone to apply for role which includes patrolling "beautiful" beaches?

title: Duchess of Cambridge releases photos of visit to army training
description: Marking Armed Forces Day, she pays tribute to the "brave men and women" serving around the world.

title: Norway shooting: Man charged with terrorism after deadly Oslo attack
description: Two were killed and 21 injured ahead of Oslo Pride, and police say it may have been a hate crime.

title: 'Irreplaceable' vinyls sold at Rowsley car boot by mistake
description: A relative was storing the records while Rohan Mellor moved house, but they got mixed up.

title: The moment a woman was saved from rushing flood waters in China
description: It took rescue crews multiple attempts to reach the woman who was clinging to her car.

title: The villagers who bought their own petrol pumps
description: Residents of Newcastleton in the Borders used to face a lengthy round-trip to get their fuel.

title: Taiwo Awoniyi: Nottingham Forest sign Nigeria forward from Union Berlin for club-record fee
description: Nottingham Forest sign Nigeria international Taiwo Awoniyi for club-record fee from Union Berlin.

title: Bellator 282: Johnny Eblen ends Gegard Mousasi's reign as middleweight champion
description: American fighter Johnny Eblen is the new middleweight champion after outclassing Gegard Mousasi in a huge upset at Bellator 282.

title: Yorkshire Three Peaks walkers removing stones from walls and slopes
description: Walkers are being reminded not to take stones from walls and slopes in the Dales.

title: Johnny Onions: Cardiff French onion seller retires
description: Patrick Mevel says he has lifted more than 20,000 tonnes of onions over the past 43 years.

title: US Championships: Fred Kerley & Melissa Jefferson win 100m titles
description: Fred Kerley wins the men's 100m at the US Championships after running a world-leading time in the semi-finals.

title: England v Netherlands: Lionesses status grows as message sent to Euros rivals
description: England have been tagged as favourites to win the Euros and they sent a message to their rivals with an impressive win over the Netherlands on Friday.

title: Roe v Wade: Abortion clinics start to close after Supreme Court ruling
description: After the Supreme Court removed the constitutional right to abortion, some states have outlawed it.

title: The Papers: Tories tell PM 'go now' and 'US bans abortion'
description: The papers lead with Boris Johnson being urged to quit and Roe v Wade being overturned in the US.

title: Roe v Wade: Inside an Arkansas abortion clinic on its last day
description: Clinics across the country shut down after Roe v Wade was overturned by the Supreme Court.

title: Eighteen dead trying to cross into Spanish enclave of Melilla
description: A huge crowd of migrants storm a fence into Melilla in North Africa, with many killed and injured.

title: Billie Eilish protests US abortion ruling at Glastonbury
description: The 20-year-old calls the decision to end the constitutional right to abortion a "dark day".
